TopicTitle: All, KSP is a fun game and all but.....

Articles.Content: It will never be complete until we see a giant statue of liberty holding a vacuum cleaner in orbit.
Then build one. Bonus points if you can make it transform.

The vacuum cleaner liberty is all well and good, but is this too much to ask also?

After all, Kertrand Russell is a well known figure in Kerbal philosophy, as well as space tea parties.
Well, they've already gone to plaid...

The vacuum cleaner liberty is all well and good, but is this too much to ask also? ...

Coincidentally, someone last night was asking me if there was one of those, or if anyone had looked for it.
There's already a Winnie out there. All we need is KSP: The Cereal and KSP: The Beach Towel.

There's already a Winnie out there. All we need is KSP: The Cereal and KSP: The Beach Towel.

Wow, that is really cool.

I would try to build the statue of liberty but alas, I am not nearly skilled enough to even position the capsule under the nose so Jeb crawls out properly....
Extra bonus points if it can transform into a ship that can reach... ludicrous speed

The vacuum cleaner liberty is all well and good, but is this too much to ask also?

~snip~

After all, Kertrand Russell is a well known figure in Kerbal philosophy, as well as space tea parties.

How do you know there isn't one orbiting between Kerbin and Duna right now? Its so small you'd never find it!

There's already a Winnie out there. All we need is KSP: The Cereal and KSP: The Beach Towel.

And KSP: The Flamethrower, A Children's Toy.

After all, Kertrand Russell is a well known figure in Kerbal philosophy, as well as space tea parties.

My god, that's amazing, my wife just 30 mins ago asked if I could make a teapot in space!
I've seen a teapot in space on the pcgamer website.
I never understood the 'gone to plaid' reference, i'm assuming its a pun or something, but it always fell flat for me. Anyone know what that was about?

It's referencing Spaceballs.

At Ludicrous Speed, everything goes plaid.
